Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Agency: Health & Human Services Department Office of Inspector General
Info Source: FOIA314
Notes: Source document obtained through a Freedom of Information Act request to the agency.

Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/usao-nj/pr/newark-hospital-pay-450000-allegedly-billing-health-care-programs-unnecessary-procedures

Company: Prime Healthcare Services, Inc. et al.
Description: Prime Healthcare Services, Inc., Prime Healthcare Foundation, Inc., and Prime Healthcare Management, Inc. as well as Prime's Founder and Chief Executive Officer, Dr. Prem Reddy, agreed to pay the United States $65 million to settle allegations that 14 Prime hospitals in California knowingly submitted false claims to Medicare by admitting patients who required only less costly, outpatient care and by billing for more expensive patient diagnoses than the patients had (a practice known as up-coding). Under the settlement agreement, Dr. Reddy will pay $3,250,000 and Prime will pay $61,750,000.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/prime-healthcare-services-and-ceo-pay-65-million-settle-false-claims-act-allegations
https://www.justice.gov/usao-edpa/pr/prime-healthcare-services-and-ceo-dr-prem-reddy-pay-125-million-settle-false-claims-act

Company: Prime Healthcare Services - Lower Bucks, LLC
Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: February 7, 2020 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Prime Healthcare agreed to pay a total of $33,725,000 to the State of California and the United States in settlement of allegations it made false claims when billing federal and state healthcare programs for patient treatment. Penalty amount listed is the State share of the settlement. The larger settlement was also announced by the U.S. Justice Department (see separate entry).
Info Source: https://www.oag.ca.gov/news/press-releases/attorney-general-bonta-and-us-department-justice-announce-375-million-settlement

Description: Prime Healthcare Services system agreed to pay more than $35 million to the federal government to resolve alleged violations of the False Claims Act. Another $2 million was paid to the State of California (see separate entry).
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/prime-healthcare-services-and-two-doctors-agree-pay-375-million-settle-allegations-kickbacks
